query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
13 Ne l’ora che comincia i tristi lai 14 la rondinella presso a la mattina, 15 forse a memoria de’ suo’ primi guai,
16 e che la mente nostra, peregrina 17 più da la carne e men da’ pensier presa, 18 a le sue visïon quasi è divina,
19 in sogno mi parea veder sospesa 20 un’aguglia nel ciel con penne d’oro, 21 con l’ali aperte e a calare intesa;
22 ed esser mi parea là dove fuoro 23 abbandonati i suoi da Ganimede, 24 quando fu ratto al sommo consistoro.
query.result:
**English:**
13 At the hour when the mournful songs begin 14 of the swallow near the morning, 15 perhaps in memory of her first sorrows,
16 and when our mind, a pilgrim, 17 less engrossed by the flesh and more by thoughts, 18 is almost divine in its visions,
19 in a dream I seemed to see suspended 20 an eagle in the sky with golden feathers, 21 with its wings spread and intent on descending;
22 and I seemed to be where Ganymede's companions were abandoned, 23 when he was snatched up to the highest consistory.
**Malay:**
13 Pada waktu ketika lagu-lagu sedih dimulai 14 burung layang-layang menjelang pagi, 15 mungkin untuk mengenang kesedihan pertamanya,
16 dan ketika pikiran kita, seorang pengembara, 17 kurang asyik dengan daging dan lebih banyak dengan pikiran, 18 dalam penglihatannya hampir seperti dewa,
19 dalam mimpi aku seperti melihat tergantung 20 seekor elang di langit dengan bulu-bulu emas, 21 dengan sayap terbuka dan berniat untuk turun;
22 dan aku seperti berada di tempat di mana teman-teman Ganimede ditinggalkan, 23 ketika dia dibawa ke konsistori tertinggi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
25 Fra me pensava: ‘Forse questa fiede 26 pur qui per uso, e forse d’altro loco 27 disdegna di portarne suso in piede’.
query.result:
**English:**
25 Within myself I thought: ‘Perhaps this stench 26 is here only because of habit, and perhaps from some other place 27 it disdains to carry us up on its feet’.
**Malay:**
25 Dalam hati kupikirkan: ‘Mungkin bau busuk ini 26 hanya ada di sini karena kebiasaan, dan mungkin dari tempat lain 27 ia enggan membawa kita naik dengan kakinya’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
28 Poi mi parea che, poi rotata un poco, 29 terribil come folgor discendesse, 30 e me rapisse suso infino al foco.
query.result:
**English:**
28 Then it seemed to me that, after turning a little, 29 something terrible descended like lightning, 30 and snatched me up to the fire.
**Malay:**
28 Kemudian tampaklah bagiku bahwa, setelah berputar sedikit, 29 sesuatu yang mengerikan turun seperti kilat, 30 dan menyambar aku hingga ke api.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
31 Ivi parea che ella e io ardesse; 32 e sì lo ’ncendio imaginato cosse, 33 che convenne che ’l sonno si rompesse.
query.result:
**English:**
31 There it seemed that she and I were burning; 32 and so the imagined fire stung, 33 that it was necessary that sleep be broken.
**Malay:**
31 Di sana tampak bahwa dia dan aku terbakar; 32 dan begitulah sengatan api yang dibayangkan, 33 sehingga tidur harus terputus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
34 Non altrimenti Achille si riscosse, 35 li occhi svegliati rivolgendo in giro 36 e non sappiendo là dove si fosse,
37 quando la madre da Chirón a Schiro 38 trafuggò lui dormendo in le sue braccia, 39 là onde poi li Greci il dipartiro;
40 che mi scoss’ io, sì come da la faccia 41 mi fuggì ’l sonno, e diventa’ ismorto, 42 come fa l’uom che, spaventato, agghiaccia.
query.result:
**English:**
34 Not otherwise did Achilles start up, 35 turning his awakened eyes around, 36 and not knowing where he was,
37 when his mother snatched him away from Chiron to Scyros, 38 while he was sleeping in her arms, 39 from where the Greeks later took him away;
40 than I started up, as sleep 41 fled from my face, and I became pale, 42 as a man who, frightened, turns cold.
**Malay:**
34 Tidaklah berbeda dengan cara Achilles terbangun, 35 memutar matanya yang terjaga ke sekeliling 36 dan tidak tahu di mana dia berada,
37 ketika ibunya membawanya pergi dari Chiron ke Scyros, 38 saat dia sedang tidur dalam pelukannya, 39 dari tempat orang-orang Yunani kemudian membawanya pergi;
40 daripada aku terbangun, saat tidur 41 lari dari wajahku, dan aku menjadi pucat, 42 seperti seorang pria yang ketakutan, menjadi dingin.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
43 Dallato m’era solo il mio conforto, 44 e ’l sole er’ alto già più che due ore, 45 e ’l viso m’era a la marina torto.
query.result:
**English:**
43 By my side was only my comfort, 44 and the sun was already more than two hours high, 45 and my face was turned towards the sea.
**Malay:**
43 Di sampingku hanya ada penghiburanku, 44 dan matahari sudah lebih dari dua jam tinggi, 45 dan wajahku menghadap ke laut.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
49 Tu se’ omai al purgatorio giunto: 50 vedi là il balzo che ’l chiude dintorno; 51 vedi l’entrata là ’ve par digiunto.
query.result:
**English:**
49 You have now arrived at Purgatory: 50 see there the cliff that encloses it all around; 51 see the entrance there where it seems to be broken off.
**Malay:**
49 Kamu sekarang telah sampai di Api Penyucian: 50 lihatlah di sana tebing yang menutupinya di sekeliling; 51 lihatlah pintu masuk di sana yang tampaknya terputus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
52 Dianzi, ne l’alba che procede al giorno, 53 quando l’anima tua dentro dormia, 54 sovra li fiori ond’ è là giù addorno
55 venne una donna, e disse: “I’ son Lucia; 56 lasciatemi pigliar costui che dorme; 57 sì l’agevolerò per la sua via”.
query.result:
**English:**
52 Just now, in the dawn that precedes the day, 53 when your soul was sleeping within, 54 over the flowers that adorn the place below,
55 a lady came and said: “I am Lucia; 56 let me take this sleeping man; 57 I will help him on his way.”
**Malay:**
52 Baru saja, di waktu fajar yang mendahului siang, 53 ketika jiwamu sedang tidur di dalam, 54 di atas bunga-bunga yang menghiasi tempat di bawah sana,
55 datanglah seorang wanita dan berkata: “Akulah Lucia; 56 biarkan aku mengambil orang yang sedang tidur ini; 57 aku akan membantunya dalam perjalanannya.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
58 Sordel rimase e l’altre genti forme; 59 ella ti tolse, e come ’l dì fu chiaro, 60 sen venne suso; e io per le sue orme.
query.result:
**English:**
58 Sordello remained and the other noble forms; 59 she took you away, and when it was daylight, 60 she came up; and I followed in her footsteps.
**Malay:**
58 Sordello tetap tinggal dan para bangsawan lainnya; 59 dia membawamu pergi, dan ketika hari terang, 60 dia datang ke atas; dan aku mengikuti jejaknya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
61 Qui ti posò, ma pria mi dimostraro 62 li occhi suoi belli quella intrata aperta; 63 poi ella e ’l sonno ad una se n’andaro».
query.result:
**English:**
61 Here she placed me, but first her lovely eyes 62 showed me that open entrance; 63 then she and sleep departed together.
**Malay:**
61 Di sinilah dia meninggalkanku, tetapi sebelumnya matanya yang cantik 62 menunjukkan kepadaku pintu masuk yang terbuka itu; 63 kemudian dia dan tidur pergi bersama.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
64 A guisa d’uom che ’n dubbio si raccerta 65 e che muta in conforto sua paura, 66 poi che la verità li è discoperta,
67 mi cambia’ io; e come sanza cura 68 vide me ’l duca mio, su per lo balzo 69 si mosse, e io di rietro inver’ l’altura.
query.result:
**English:**
64 Like a man who reassures himself in doubt 65 and changes his fear into comfort, 66 after the truth has been revealed to him,
67 I changed; and as my guide saw me without worry, 68 he moved up the cliff, 69 and I followed him towards the heights.
**Malay:**
64 Seperti seorang lelaki yang meyakinkan dirinya dalam keraguan 65 dan mengubah ketakutannya menjadi ketenangan, 66 setelah kebenaran telah disingkapkan kepadanya,
67 aku berubah; dan ketika pemanduku melihatku tanpa khawatir, 68 ia bergerak naik tebing, 69 dan aku mengikutinya menuju puncak.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
70 Lettor, tu vedi ben com’ io innalzo 71 la mia matera, e però con più arte 72 non ti maravigliar s’io la rincalzo.
query.result:
**English:**
70 Reader, you see well how I exalt 71 my subject matter, and therefore with more art 72 do not be surprised if I reinforce it.
**Malay:**
70 Pembaca, kamu lihat dengan baik bagaimana aku meninggikan 71 bahan pokokku, dan oleh karena itu dengan lebih banyak seni 72 jangan heran jika aku menekankannya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
73 Noi ci appressammo, ed eravamo in parte 74 che là dove pareami prima rotto, 75 pur come un fesso che muro diparte,
76 vidi una porta, e tre gradi di sotto 77 per gire ad essa, di color diversi, 78 e un portier ch’ancor non facea motto.
query.result:
**English:**
73 We approached, and we were in a part 74 where it seemed to me broken before, 75 just like a crack that divides a wall,
76 I saw a gate, and three steps below 77 to go to it, of different colors, 78 and a doorkeeper who still did not speak.
**Malay:**
73 Kami mendekat, dan kami berada di bagian 74 yang di mana sebelumnya tampak retak, 75 seperti celah yang membelah tembok,
76 aku melihat sebuah pintu gerbang, dan tiga anak tangga di bawahnya 77 untuk menuju ke sana, dengan warna yang berbeda, 78 dan seorang penjaga pintu yang masih tidak berbicara.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
85 «Dite costinci: che volete voi?», 86 cominciò elli a dire, «ov’ è la scorta? 87 Guardate che ’l venir sù non vi nòi».
query.result:
**English:**
85 “Tell me here: what do you want?”, 86 he began to say, “where is your guide? 87 Beware that coming up here may not be good for you”.
**Malay:**
85 “Katakan padaku di sini: apa yang kalian inginkan?”, 86 dimulailah ia berkata, “di mana pemandu kalian? 87 Hati-hatilah bahwa datang ke atas sini mungkin tidak baik untuk kalian”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
88 «Donna del ciel, di queste cose accorta», 89 rispuose ’l mio maestro a lui, «pur dianzi 90 ne disse: “Andate là: quivi è la porta”».
query.result:
**English:**
88 "Lady of heaven, aware of these things," 89 my master replied to him, "just now 90 she said to us: 'Go there: there is the gate.'"
**Malay:**
88 "Wanita dari syurga, yang mengetahui hal-hal ini," 89 jawab guruku kepadanya, "tadi 90 dia berkata kepada kita: 'Pergilah ke sana: di sanalah pintunya.'"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
91 «Ed ella i passi vostri in bene avanzi», 92 ricominciò il cortese portinaio: 93 «Venite dunque a’ nostri gradi innanzi».
query.result:
**English:**
91 "And may she advance your steps for good," 92 the courteous gatekeeper began again, 93 "Come then before our steps."
**Malay:**
91 "Dan semoga dia memajukan langkah-langkahmu untuk kebaikan," 92 penjaga gerbang yang sopan itu mulai lagi, 93 "Datanglah ke hadapan tangga-tangga kami."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
94 Là ne venimmo; e lo scaglion primaio 95 bianco marmo era sì pulito e terso, 96 ch’io mi specchiai in esso qual io paio.
query.result:
**English:**
94 There we came; and the first step 95 was of white marble so polished and smooth, 96 that I saw myself in it as I appear.
**Malay:**
94 Di sanalah kami tiba; dan anak tangga pertama 95 adalah marmar putih yang begitu halus dan bersih, 96 sehingga aku dapat melihat diriku sendiri di dalamnya sebagaimana aku adanya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
97 Era il secondo tinto più che perso, 98 d’una petrina ruvida e arsiccia, 99 crepata per lo lungo e per traverso.
query.result:
**English:**
97 It was the second hour, more than half gone, 98 of a rough and parched stone, 99 cracked lengthwise and across.
**Malay:**
97 Saat itu jam kedua, lebih dari separuh berlalu, 98 dari sebuah batu yang kasar dan kering, 99 retak memanjang dan melintang.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
100 Lo terzo, che di sopra s’ammassiccia, 101 porfido mi parea, sì fiammeggiante 102 come sangue che fuor di vena spiccia.
query.result:
**English:**
100 The third, which masses itself above, 101 seemed to me porphyry, so flaming red 102 as blood that spurts forth from a vein.
**Malay:**
100 Yang ketiga, yang berkumpul di atas, 101 tampak bagiku seperti batu porfiri, begitu menyala 102 seperti darah yang menyembur keluar dari urat nadi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
103 Sovra questo tenëa ambo le piante 104 l’angel di Dio sedendo in su la soglia 105 che mi sembiava pietra di diamante.
query.result:
**English:**
103 Upon this he held both his soles, 104 the angel of God sitting on the threshold 105 that seemed to me to be a diamond stone.
**Malay:**
103 Di atasnya malaikat Tuhan duduk di ambang pintu 104 yang tampak bagiku seperti batu berlian. 105 Dengan ini dia memegang kedua telapak kakinya,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
106 Per li tre gradi sù di buona voglia 107 mi trasse il duca mio, dicendo: «Chiedi 108 umilemente che ’l serrame scioglia».
query.result:
**English:**
106 Up the three steps with good will 107 my leader drew me, saying: "Ask 108 humbly that he unbolt the lock".
**Malay:**
106 Ke atas tiga anak tangga dengan niat baik 107 pemimpinku membawaku, berkata: "Mintalah 108 dengan rendah hati agar dia membuka gerendel".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 Divoto mi gittai a’ santi piedi; 110 misericordia chiesi e ch’el m’aprisse, 111 ma tre volte nel petto pria mi diedi.
query.result:
**English:**
109 Devoutly I threw myself at the holy feet; 110 I asked for mercy and for him to open up to me, 111 but first I struck myself in the chest three times.
**Malay:**
109 Dengan taat aku melemparkan diriku ke kaki-kaki yang suci; 110 aku memohon belas kasihan dan agar dia membukakan pintu bagiku, 111 tetapi pertama-tama aku memukul dada sebanyak tiga kali.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
112 Sette P ne la fronte mi descrisse 113 col punton de la spada, e «Fa che lavi, 114 quando se’ dentro, queste piaghe» disse.
query.result:
**English:**
112 Seven Ps he inscribed on my forehead 113 with the point of his sword, and said, "Make sure you wash 114 these wounds when you are inside."
**Malay:**
112 Tujuh P di dahiku digoreskannya 113 dengan ujung pedangnya, dan berkata, "Pastikan kau basuh 114 luka-luka ini ketika kau berada di dalam."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
115 Cenere, o terra che secca si cavi, 116 d’un color fora col suo vestimento; 117 e di sotto da quel trasse due chiavi.
query.result:
**English:**
115 Ashes, or earth that is dug up dry, 116 would be of a color with his vestment; 117 and from beneath that he drew two keys.
**Malay:**
115 Abu, atau tanah yang digali kering, 116 akan berwarna sama dengan pakaiannya; 117 dan dari bawah itu ia mengeluarkan dua kunci.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
118 L’una era d’oro e l’altra era d’argento; 119 pria con la bianca e poscia con la gialla 120 fece a la porta sì, ch’i’ fu’ contento.
query.result:
**English:**
118 One was of gold and the other was of silver; 119 first with the white and then with the yellow key 120 he did such things at the gate that I was content.
**Malay:**
118 Yang satu terbuat dari emas dan yang lainnya terbuat dari perak; 119 pertama dengan kunci putih dan kemudian dengan kunci kuning 120 dia melakukan hal-hal seperti itu di gerbang sehingga aku merasa puas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
121 «Quandunque l’una d’este chiavi falla, 122 che non si volga dritta per la toppa», 123 diss’ elli a noi, «non s’apre questa calla.
query.result:
**English:**
121 "Whenever one of these keys fails, 122 so that it does not turn straight in the lock," 123 he said to us, "this gate does not open.
**Malay:**
121 "Setiap kali salah satu dari kunci ini gagal, 122 sehingga tidak berputar lurus di lubang kunci," 123 katanya kepada kami, "gerbang ini tidak terbuka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
124 Più cara è l’una; ma l’altra vuol troppa 125 d’arte e d’ingegno avanti che diserri, 126 perch’ ella è quella che ’l nodo digroppa.
query.result:
**English:**
124 One way is easier, but the other requires 125 too much skill and intelligence before it opens, 126 because it is the one that unties the knot.
**Malay:**
124 Satu cara lebih mudah, tetapi yang lain memerlukan 125 terlalu banyak kemahiran dan kecerdasan sebelum terbuka, 126 karena itulah yang melepaskan ikatan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
127 Da Pier le tegno; e dissemi ch’i’ erri 128 anzi ad aprir ch’a tenerla serrata, 129 pur che la gente a’ piedi mi s’atterri».
query.result:
**English:**
127 From Pier the sign; and he told me that I was wrong 128 to open it rather than to keep it shut, 129 even if the people on foot should fall down before me».
**Malay:**
127 Dari Pier tandanya; dan dia mengatakan kepadaku bahwa aku salah 128 untuk membukanya daripada tetap menutupnya, 129 meskipun orang-orang yang berjalan kaki harus jatuh di hadapanku».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
130 Poi pinse l’uscio a la porta sacrata, 131 dicendo: «Intrate; ma facciovi accorti 132 che di fuor torna chi ’n dietro si guata».
query.result:
**English:**
130 Then he pushed the door of the sacred gate, 131 saying: "Enter; but I warn you 132 that whoever looks back will return outside."
**Malay:**
130 Kemudian dia mendorong pintu gerbang suci, 131 berkata: "Masuklah; tetapi aku memperingatkanmu 132 bahwa siapa pun yang melihat ke belakang akan kembali ke luar."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
133 E quando fuor ne’ cardini distorti 134 li spigoli di quella regge sacra, 135 che di metallo son sonanti e forti,
136 non rugghiò sì né si mostrò sì acra 137 Tarpëa, come tolto le fu il buono 138 Metello, per che poi rimase macra.
query.result:
**English:**
133 And when the pivots of that sacred gate, 134 the corners of which are of strong and sonorous metal, 135 were outside their distorted hinges,
136 Tarpeia did not roar or show herself so fierce 137 when the good Metellus was taken from her, 138 because of which she then remained lean.
**Malay:**
133 Dan ketika poros-poros gerbang suci itu, 134 yang sudut-sudutnya terbuat dari logam yang kuat dan berbunyi nyaring, 135 berada di luar engsel-engselnya yang bengkok,
136 Tarpeia tidak mengaum atau menunjukkan dirinya begitu garang 137 ketika Metellus yang baik diambil darinya, 138 karena itu kemudian dia tetap kurus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
139 Io mi rivolsi attento al primo tuono, 140 e ‘Te Deum laudamus’ mi parea 141 udire in voce mista al dolce suono.
query.result:
**English:**
139 I turned attentively to the first thunderclap, 140 and it seemed to me that I heard 141 “Te Deum laudamus” mixed in with the sweet sound.
**Malay:**
139 Aku berpaling dengan penuh perhatian pada guntur pertama, 140 dan “Te Deum laudamus” kurasa 141 kudengar dalam suara yang bercampur dengan bunyi yang merdu.
